title.narrative: Future proof business model for Kabete Dairy

description.narrative:
In May 2016, the company assessment of Kabete Dairy was conducted.
The mission team concluded:
The purpose of the mission was to achieve an in-depth understanding of the practiceand future aspirations of Kabete Dairy cooperative. Based on their analysis, the teamgave a positive advice to Agriterra to start a partnership with the cooperative. TheAction plan will however be developed later after the cooperative submits the newStrategic Plan for review.The mission team concluded that:The cooperative needs to clearly define its long term objective and develop a clearstrategy to achieve these objectives. Agriterra could help the organization achievingits objectives by sharing its expertise. Before making a decision on pasteurization,there is need to develop a business plan which will guide this decision and view otheroptions that are at hand. The daily milk intake was noted to be relatively low and so isactive membership. The management, supported by Agriterra needs to develop a planof approach on increasing the membership and also dairy milk intakes. One reasonthat is causing this low production per farmer is inadequate support and trainings onfeeding and feed rations. In addition, the board of directors and management staffneeds to be empowered in order for them to take the organization to the next level.Therefore, the team advises Agriterra to start a partnership with Kabete dairy withmajor focus on redefining the strategic objective of the organization and support thecooperative achieve it, Increase production and professionalize the organization.
Based on the outcomes of the company assessment, an action plan is drafted. It is proposed for Q4 2016 to start with a cooperatvie governance training and a mission to elaborate a Business Planning and marketing value chain analysis. A draft action plan is elaborated, but will be adjusted
Goals:1. Increase Milk production to average 16,000L per day by end of 2017 through improved extenon services to members 2. Elaborated business model for marketing of members’ milk
